fields.description: When uploading a pre-commit patch (in diff -u format) to Crucible, the review pages for files try to generate links out of the before & after elements.  But, these resolve to invalid pages, such as https://www.limewire.org/fisheye/changelog/PATCH:719/?cs=12:T or https://www.limewire.org/fisheye/changelog/PATCH:719/?cs=12:F .  These generate ugly looking 404 pages.
fields.summary: Invalid links in Crucible when reviewing an uploaded patch

fields.description: any comment I added while using Crucible before upgrading to 2.0.6 (was using 1.6) can't be marked as read and perpetually show up as unread.  to add insult to injury, the "mark all comments read" text seems to do absolutely nothing...
fields.summary: Comments I added in 1.6 always show as unread

fields.description: Currently only english is supported. Please provide translations of the interface to other langages, as is the case in JIRA or Confluence.

fields.description:
Brendan's keen to try some postit like styling on the comments. Yellow for comments, red for defects, grey for drafts.

First pass will see:
read/unread shown by 1) thickness of border and 2) bold/unbold "Commenter says..."
selected/active shown by changing border color to blue

Will rinse and repeat!
fields.summary: Evolve comment styling to mirror postit notes

fields.description: When I'm reviewing code, I often switch between files to cross reference code. When I come back to the FRX which I'm writing a comment on, I have to find the comment which I've been writing. It would be nice to automatically scroll to the comment form which is visible when activating a file.
fields.summary: When switching frxs, scroll to an open comment form if one exists
Provide full list of available parameters for email notifications customization

fields.summary: Comment hovers ".. replies hidden" is incorrect

fields.description: Make it possible to change a review's due date through the SPI.
fields.summary: Make due dates configurable through SPI

fields.description:
Information about comments that are linked to a jira issue is not exposed through the SPI.
We need to make this information available and it must be possible for clients to create subtasks for comments.

Following discussions with Wojtek, we came up with the following starting point:

* Add jiraIssueKey to CommentData (for retrieval)
* Use {{POST /comments/4523/issues}} to create a new jira subtask for a comment (returns the new issue key)
* Use {{DELETE /comments/4523/issues/CLOV-235}} to delete a jira subtask
* Use {{POST /comments/4523/issues/CLOV-235}} with some action string to resolve (do this restful)
* Use {{GET /comments/4523/issues}} to retrieve all linked jira issues

N.B.
Issue creation is done by Crucible, so the client does not need to talk to Jira.
fields.summary: Add comment-create-jira functionality to SPI

fields.summary: Failure to delete reviews after a reviewer has viewed them.

fields.description: currently the highlighting changes, but the tree pane isn't scrolled.
fields.summary: scrolling Multi-FRX mode should also scroll the LHS tree to always show the currently selected FRX

fields.description:
When in full screen mode, there is now white space to the left of the top 3 review buttons, with the file header below them.

This takes up valuable vertical screen real estate.
fields.summary: Unused whitespace in fullscreen mode header

fields.description:
Currently the dashboard remembers the last user filter and returns to that view - sans filter in the URL - on returning to the dashboard. This results in the messages like  'No reviews found for filter "To Review"' even though there's no filter in evidence, and despite there being open actions to be completed. 

Given that the actions in the left hand column are ordered smartly, lets streamline the users action path and rather than showing a dead-end on the screen, detect when the user has open actions in the left hand column and change the reviews shown in the content column accordingly.

If you leave the dashboard with 1 item to review and 1 to summarise and complete the review, rather than return to the To Review screen, you get shown the To Summarise screen and are one click closer to a streamlined workflow.
fields.summary: Dashboard smartly displays the next thing for me to focus on
Asking a Light SCM repo for a particular changeset should report an error, or at least log a warning

fields.description:
The custom nav forward/back allows you to toggle the navigation of Files/Comments/Defects
!http://madbean.com/pub/skitch/2009/customnav-20091021-105310.jpg!

It would also be nice to have an orthogonal toggle to just navigate to the Unread instances of Files/Comments/Defects.

You could
# do that with another checkbox in the filter dropdown
# do that with a SHIFT modifier on the {{,}} and {{.}} keys (i.e. {{<}} and {{>}}). It would be good if these SHIFT versions were congruent with {{SHIFT-Y}} which ensures the current FRX is marked as read. {{SHIFT-,}} and {{SHIFT-.}} should ensure the current thing is marked as read before going next?
fields.summary: Custom Navigation should support a Read/Unread modifier

fields.description:
is it worth renaming {{s/getAllProjectKeys/getAllCurrentAndHistoricalProjectKeys/}} ?

Created from Crucible comment by Tim Pettersen: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2557#c22814
fields.summary: is it worth renaming {{s/getAllProjectKeys/getAllCurrentAndHistoricalProjectKeys/}} ?
Performance of sticky header

fields.description: For ie5, ie6 we should fail firmly and cleanly, displaying a message that the browser is not supported. The current experience is that the application half works, but is broken in fundamental ways to render it completely useless.
fields.summary: Fail cleanly and firmly for well-known unsupported browsers
Subtask creation doesn't correctly pass Polish (and probably other native i18n) characters
Repository property "enable-line-history" doesn't work

fields.description: EyeQL search in Crucible review edit dialog search tab (that was a mouthful) doesn't work. The search button does not do anything.
fields.summary: Crucible EyeQL search does not work

fields.description: If you click "Create Review" on a changeset when you don't have permission to create a review in any projects, you are presented with a select project dialog with an empty dropdown.
fields.summary: "Create Review" with no permission displays empty select project dialog

fields.description:
Mike Cannon-Brookes:
idea
is there any reason in the FishEye/Crucible JIRA plugin, we couldn't have top level nav items?
so when you have FE plugin installed, and it's connected/activated - you get a "Source" drop down next to "Issues"
(getting closer to Studio behind the firewall)
the dropdown menu could have anything you wanted - it's ajax lazy loaded - repositories, link to search etc

Brendan Humphreys:
assuming the plugin point exists in JIRA, no reason not to have it
great idea

Mike Cannon-Brookes:
yup - all the J4 menus are just web fragments
so you can add new items, menus etc with basically just XML
and small Java 'condition' classes to determine whether to show or not programmatically
seems like a very high value, low cost feature to give people that integration 'feeling'

Brendan Humphreys:
would we have a top level "reviews" nav item, or is that too marginal?

Mike Cannon-Brookes:
we could have a Reviews tab just the same

Brendan Humphreys:
snap
I guess both could be configurable

Mike Cannon-Brookes:
can we determine from within JIRA whether Crucible is 'connected' ?

Brendan Humphreys:
yeah

Mike Cannon-Brookes:
then I'd say if it's connected, we'd show that
can we determine any history or anything via ajax?

Brendan Humphreys:
as in "recent reviews" or the like?

Mike Cannon-Brookes:
yup - anything really
the 'recent issues' is pulled via ajax when you open the menu, so I think the Crucible one could have your last 4 reviews plus a few links to create new review, search all reviews, etc

Brendan Humphreys:
yeah, I think we can come up with something
fields.summary: [JIRA plugin] add top level nav items to the JIRA nav bar - Source and Reviews

fields.description:
In our environment, we have a team of "Reviewers" that will pick-up code to review by creating the reviews and reviewing the code.  Thus, the "reviewer" is always the "moderator" and there are no reviewers per-se, just the moderator and author.  When the reviewer completes his review, but (for some reason) then decides to "Uncomplete" his/her review, the following error is displayed when clicking the Uncomplete button:
"There was an error in the response from the server.
Refresh the page before posting more comments.
Click 'show details' for more information.
Show details
Details:
The reported problem was:
Error 1
The supplied participant is not a reviewer.
You are running release CR2.0.3 FE2.0.3 (build-417 2009-08-17), please report your release number when reporting bugs. "
This was received
fields.summary: Moderator can Complete but cannot Uncomplete

fields.description:
While setting up and demoing out JIRA + Crucible + IntelliJ Connector I encounter the following problem related to raising JIRA issue (subtask) directly from Crucible UI (comment):

- logged-in user in Crucible must have "administrate project" permission in JIRA - otherwise issue creation fails with the message about "probably missing permissions". Coming to this conclusion required some experimenting from me. It does not make sense IMO...
- even if my logged-in user in Crucible (say user A) has aforementioned permissions, then created JIRA issue from Crucible UI uses as Reporter field incorrectly the account provided in JIRA Servers configuration in Crucible (even though use trusted apps is checked). Interestingly resolving issues takes correctly! currently logged-in Crucible user (you can see it in the issue history).
- Polish (and probably also other non-English) characters are incorrectly passed to JIRA. That is they are displayed correctly in Crucible, but JIRA issue contains rubbish characters instead of Polish ones. Encoding problems?
fields.summary: Raising JIRA issues from Crucible is borked

fields.description:
no committers in activity constraints:

||[!http://content.screencast.com/users/tpettersen/folders/Jing/media/82c652a7-435c-4169-b294-ce4dd89f9fcd/2009-10-19_1648.png|width=600!|http://screencast.com/t/U8vF4t26]||

----
some diagnostics:
{quote}authors are shown for directories, but not for files - the call to RevisionCache.findAuthors(path) is returning nothing if the path is a file.{quote}
fields.summary: the committer dropdown list is empty in the activity stream filter when looking at a file
Refactor api dependencies on branch

fields.description: For reviews with more than 100 FRXs, disable multi-FRX mode. Disable the button, and put a hover on it to say "Multi-file mode is disabled due to the large number of revisions in this review"
fields.summary: Disable multi-FRX mode for reviews with large number of FRXes.

fields.description:
When a review is created from a large (1000's of revisions) changeset, the cost of calculating associated reviews becomes prohibitively expensive. 

Timebox the review suggestion calculation process, so that it spends no longer than 10 seconds calculating associated reviews. When presenting subsequent suggestions, if based on only a subset of the entire revision list, verbage needs to be added to the dialog to that effect: "These suggestions based on analysis of the first NNN revisions).
fields.summary: Improve performance of Create Review from changeset

fields.description:
See screenshot - there are missing arrows for both collapsed and expanded changeset files for binary files.

example: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/changelog/FE/?cs=42122
fields.summary: Changeset revision icons missing for binary files

fields.description: When I go into people, select a person, then Tools > Create a review, I would expect that the changesets, etc are already filtered by the person I was just viewing.
fields.summary: Streamline "create review" when viewing people

fields.description: If would be nice if every commit could have smaller simple reviews or comments. I should be able to go into the dashboard, click any entry under commit activity, and do a simple review that notifies the commiter ( if mapped ), without having to go through an entire review process.
fields.summary: Simple commit comments
Some characters in comments are lost when downloading the review as text

fields.description:
Because SCMSource doesn't implement getChangeSet(String csid), you can't use the SPI's ReviewService.createReviewFromChangeSets() method.

Also see:
http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257320635#257320635
fields.summary: SPI's createReviewFromChangeset fails for lightSCM repos

fields.description:
This includes
- fixing the location of the 'virtual viewport' (at the moment when you click to select a file, it remains the currently active element when it is below the files container
- optimizing the scroll tracker
fields.summary: Refine the auto-focus of files
Show inline dialog for editing review subtask details before posting to JIRA

fields.description:
[via Joe|https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2530#c22416]:

{quote}i dont often do it, but sometimes i copy the path of the file from the header - with the truncation now you lose that. It'd be good if we could chuck a confluence, and have the ellipses clickable to expand to the full path...{quote}
fields.summary: Expand the truncated path in the file header for copying
Edit revisions overlays manage files
Top most file (even if inactive) needs the sticky header

fields.description:
The FRX header is composed of
- the frx toolbar (contains the name and view/fisheye/permalink menu/icons)
- the revision controls (slider, add/remove revs)

At the moment, the revision controls are only shown for the active FRX, which causes a noticable jump when switching FRXs.

Make it so that the entire header is always visible.
fields.summary: Always display the entire header

        at org.mortbay.thread.BoundedThreadPool$PoolThread.run(BoundedThreadPool.java:451)

This occurred after the following was done and possibly breaks other code reviews:
1) Make a code review, and somehow get fisheye to not show diffs between two files, but just list the current version in its entirety. [Not sure if this is necessary, or if this applies to any file in any code review.]
2) Have someone else add a comment to that file. [Probably any user including yourself would do.]
3) Choose to edit the code review, choosing that particular file.
4) Press the "remove" button. This does nothing, and does not even tell you why.
5) Impatiently, go down on the same page to where the circle (representing the one version of this file) is, and click on the small X next to it. This helpfully tells you that you can not delete it, as there are comments on it.
6) Refresh (or something similar).

Actual results: Page is inaccessible - see error below:


Your request was unable to be processed
javax.servlet.ServletException

    * javax.el.ELException: java.lang.NullPointerException

You are running release CR2.0.4 FE2.0.4 (build-420 2009-09-08), please report your release number when reporting bugs.

If you are experiencing any issues, please contact your administrator. You may also want to browse the documentation or search the support forums. Still stuck? You can start a support ticket, or raise a bug or feature request at etc...
fields.summary: NPE when editing a pre-existing code review

fields.description:
When you are using JIRA 4.0 you cannot create subtasks from Crucible unless you are a project administrator for the project. 

Not sure why that is yet.
fields.summary: Cannot create sub tasks from crucible unless you are a project administrator in JIRA when using JIRA 4.0
Can we please not have emoticons in Crucible?

fields.description:
I find the fact that the FRX header appears and disappears while I'm scrolling between files to be disorienting.

The entire header for inactive files always needs to be visible (and an inactive frx that is at the top should have it's header sticky)
